title: Terms of Use & Privacy Policy
appDescription: is an iOS application designed to help people who live alone signal their well-being through daily check-ins. If a user does not check in for two consecutive days, the app automatically sends an email alert on the third day to a designated emergency contact asking them to check on the user.
agreeToTerms: By using the app, you agree to the terms and practices described below.

overview.para1: {appName} is an iOS application designed to help people who live alone signal their well-being through daily check-ins. If a user does not check in for two consecutive days, the app automatically sends an email alert on the third day to a designated emergency contact asking them to check on the user.
overview.para2: By using the app, you agree to the terms and practices described below.

intendedUse.title: 2.1 Intended Use
intendedUse.para1: {appName} is a wellness support tool, not an emergency service. It does not replace medical care, emergency responders, or welfare checks conducted by authorities.
intendedUse.para2: Do not rely on this app for life-critical situations.

automatedAlerts.title: 2.2 Automated Alerts
automatedAlerts.para1: If you miss checking in for two consecutive days, the app automatically sends an email on the third day to your chosen emergency contact.
list: Emails are sent automatically via our server, without human intervention
Email delivery is not guaranteed (depends on email providers, internet connectivity)
The app cannot confirm whether the recipient reads or acts on the message
False alarms may occur if you forget to check in

accuracyOfInformation.title: 2.3 Accuracy of Information
list: Your correct name (optional, but recommended)
A valid and monitored emergency contact email address
accuracyOfInformation.para2: Incorrect or outdated information may prevent alerts from reaching the right person.

noLiability.title: 2.4 No Liability
noLiability.para1: {appName} is provided "as is" without any warranties. The developer is not liable for:
list: Missed, delayed, or undelivered emails
Internet, device, or third-party service outages
Any action or inaction taken by emergency contacts
Consequences arising from reliance on this app

userResponsibility.title: 2.5 User Responsibility
list: Checking in daily to prevent alerts
Keeping emergency contact information up to date
Informing your emergency contact that they may receive automated alerts
Understanding that this is a supplemental tool, not a replacement for professional care

whatDataWeCollect.title: 3.1 What Data We Collect
whatDataWeCollect.para1: {appName} collects only the minimum data necessary to function. No accounts, passwords, or social logins are required.

storedOnDevice.title: Stored on Device (Local Storage)
list: Your name (optional)
Emergency contact email address
Check-in history (last 30 check-in dates)
Last check-in date and time
App language preference
Text/icon size preference
Onboarding completion status

syncedToIcloud.title: Synced to iCloud
syncedToIcloud.para1: To allow data recovery when reinstalling the app or switching devices, the following data is automatically synced to your personal iCloud account using iCloud Key-Value Storage:
list: Your name (if provided)
Emergency contact email address
Last check-in date and time
Check-in history (last 30 days)
Consecutive missed days count (calculated value)
App preferences (language, text size)

syncedToCloudkit.title: Also Synced to CloudKit
syncedToCloudkit.para1: As an additional backup mechanism, your data is also synced to your private CloudKit database:
list: Device identifier (anonymous UUID, not linked to your Apple ID)
All data listed above in "Synced to iCloud"
Sync timestamp
syncedToCloudkit.important: **Important:** Both iCloud Key-Value Storage and CloudKit data are tied to your Apple ID. Only you can access this data across your devices. We do not have access to your iCloud or CloudKit data. Your data is stored in Apple's secure infrastructure.

howDataIsUsed.title: 3.2 How Data Is Used
list: Tracking your daily check-ins
Calculating consecutive missed days
Sending automated email alerts to your emergency contact when needed
Syncing data to your personal iCloud account for backup and recovery across devices
Personalizing app preferences (language, text size)
doNotList: Sell your data to third parties
Share your data except as described in this policy
Access other apps or data on your device
Access your iCloud data (it's encrypted and only accessible to you)

emailSending.title: 3.3 Email Sending Service
emailSending.para1: Automated alert emails are sent via SendGrid, a third-party email service provider, through our backend server.
howItWorks: When the app detects you've missed 2+ consecutive days, it sends an escalation request to our server
Our server (hosted on Railway) processes the request and sends an email via SendGrid
The email is sent exclusively to your provided emergency contact
list: Your name (if provided)
Number of consecutive days missed
Instructions for the recipient on what to do
Automated "DO NOT REPLY" warnings
Sent from: safety@betweendays.app
emailSending.para4: SendGrid processes the email content only for delivery purposes and does not use your data for other purposes.

pushNotifications.title: 3.4 Push Notifications
pushNotifications.para1: The app may send push notifications to remind you to check in. These require your permission and can be managed in your device settings. No personal data is collected for this feature.

localStorage.title: Local Storage
list: Data is stored securely on your device using iOS UserDefaults
Protected by your device's built-in security (passcode, Face ID, etc.)
Automatically deleted when you uninstall the app

cloudStorage.title: iCloud Storage (Key-Value Storage & CloudKit)
list: Data is stored in your personal iCloud account (operated by Apple)
Transmitted via encrypted connections
Protected by your Apple ID password and two-factor authentication
Persists even after deleting the app (to allow data recovery)
Accessible only from devices signed in with your Apple ID
Stored in Apple's secure data centers

backendServer.title: Backend Server (Railway)
list: Hosted on Railway's secure infrastructure
Does not store your personal data permanently
Only processes escalation email requests in real-time
Communicates with SendGrid via secure API for email delivery

dataRetention.title: 3.6 Data Retention
dataRetention.para1: Your data is stored in multiple places with different retention policies:

onYourDevice.title: On Your Device
list: Data remains until you uninstall the app
Uninstalling the app permanently deletes all local data

inIcloud.title: In iCloud (Key-Value Storage & CloudKit)
list: Data persists even after deleting the app
This allows data recovery if you reinstall the app
Synchronized across all your devices signed in with the same Apple ID

onRailwayServer.title: On Railway Server
list: No permanent data storage
Escalation requests are processed in real-time and not retained

toPermanentlyDelete.title: To permanently delete all data:
toPermanentlyDelete.para1: If you uninstall without resetting, data will remain in iCloud and will be restored if you reinstall the app with the same Apple ID.
toPermanentlyDelete.para2: Note: iCloud data is managed by Apple. Deleting data from our app removes it from iCloud Key-Value Storage and CloudKit, but Apple may retain backups according to their data retention policies.

yourRightsAndControl.title: 3.7 Your Rights and Control
list: View your stored information in the Settings screen
Update your name or emergency contact email
Modify app preferences (language, text size)
Stop future alerts by removing the emergency contact email
Delete all data using the "Reset All Data" option in Settings
Request data deletion assistance by contacting support (see Section 8)

thirdPartyServices.title: 3.8 Third-Party Services

icloud.title: iCloud (Apple)
list: Purpose: Cloud data storage and sync for backup and device-to-device sync
Data shared: App data syncs to your personal iCloud account via Key-Value Storage and CloudKit
Privacy policy: https://www.apple.com/legal/privacy/
Note: This is your own iCloud account - we do not have access to this data

railway.title: Railway
list: Purpose: Backend server hosting for processing escalation email requests
Data shared: Email address, name, missed days count (only when escalation is triggered)
Data retention: No permanent storage - real-time processing only
Privacy policy: https://railway.app/legal/privacy

sendgrid.title: SendGrid (Twilio)
list: Purpose: Email delivery for alerts
Data shared: Emergency contact email, your name, alert message content
Privacy policy: https://www.twilio.com/legal/privacy

thirdPartyServices.para2: These services are bound by their own privacy policies. We choose trusted providers with strong privacy practices and enterprise-grade security.

dataSharingAndDisclosure.title: 3.9 Data Sharing and Disclosure
dataSharingAndDisclosure.para1: We do not sell or rent your data to third parties.
dataSharingAndDisclosure.para2: We may only disclose your information:
list: To your designated emergency contact (as part of the alert email)
To third-party service providers (Railway, SendGrid) to the extent necessary to deliver email alerts
When required by legal process or statutory obligation
To protect rights, property, or safety
dataSharingAndDisclosure.para3: Note: Your iCloud data is stored in your personal iCloud account and is not shared with us or third parties.

childrensPrivacy.para1: {appName} is not intended for users under 13 years old. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13.
childrensPrivacy.para2: If you are a parent or guardian and believe your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us immediately so we can delete it.

internationalUsers.para1: Your iCloud data is stored in Apple data centers, which may be located in different countries depending on your region and Apple ID settings. Our backend server (Railway) operates in various global regions. SendGrid's email service operates primarily in the United States.
internationalUsers.para2: By using the app, you consent to the processing of data as described in this policy. These countries may have different data protection laws than your country of residence.
internationalUsers.chinaNote: For users in China: iCloud data is stored in Apple's data centers in China, operated by GCBD (Guizhou on the Cloud Big Data), in accordance with Chinese data protection regulations.

changesToPolicy.para1: We may update these Terms of Use and Privacy Policy from time to time. Changes will be indicated by updating the "Last updated" date at the top of this page.
changesToPolicy.para2: Your continued use of the app after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated terms.
changesToPolicy.para3: If significant changes affect your privacy rights, we will provide notice within the app when possible.

yourConsent.para1: By downloading, installing, and using {appName}, you consent to:
list: The collection and use of data as described in this policy
Sending automated alerts to your emergency contact via our backend server
Storing data in your personal iCloud account (Key-Value Storage and CloudKit)
The terms and limitations described in Section 2

contact.para1: If you have questions, concerns, or requests regarding these terms or privacy practices, please contact:
contact.para2: For data deletion requests, you can delete all data directly from the app:
contact.para3: This will delete both local and iCloud data. We will respond to privacy inquiries within 30 days.

gdpr.para1: If you are located in the European Economic Area (EEA), our legal basis for collecting and using your data is:
list: Consent: You provide explicit consent by setting up an emergency contact
Legitimate interest: Operating the core functionality of the app (check-in tracking)
rights: Delete your data ("right to be forgotten")
gdpr.para3: To exercise these rights, contact us at avdev2024@gmail.com.

ccpa.para1: If you are a California resident, you have the right to:
list: Know what personal information we collect and how we use it
Request deletion of your personal information
Opt-out of the sale of personal information (we do not sell your data)
Exercise your privacy rights without discrimination
ccpa.para3: To exercise these rights, contact us at avdev2024@gmail.com.

finalNote: By using {appName}, you acknowledge that you have read and understood this Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.
